name: Orange
shortDescription: Historic city known for its charming Old Town district, tree-lined streets, and strong community vibe.
fullDescription: Orange is a vibrant city blending historic charm with modern amenities. Famous for its preserved Old Towne district featuring antique shops, cafes, and the annual Orange International Street Fair, the city offers a welcoming community atmosphere. With quality schools, parks, and easy access to Orange County‚Äôs major freeways, Orange appeals to families and professionals alike seeking a mix of tradition and convenience.

highlights.title: Old Towne Orange Historic District
highlights.description: Preserved area with antique shops, restaurants, and annual street fairs.
highlights.bgImageAlt: Historic buildings and street in Old Towne Orange

highlights.title: Irvine Regional Park
highlights.description: Large park with hiking trails, picnic areas, and a small zoo.
highlights.bgImageAlt: Green landscape at Irvine Regional Park

highlights.title: Orange Plaza
highlights.description: Town square hosting community events, farmers markets, and live music.

highlights.title: Community Events
highlights.description: Popular events include the Orange International Street Fair and holiday parades.
highlights.bgImageAlt: Street fair with crowds and booths

faqs.question: What is Orange known for?
faqs.answer: Orange is known for its historic Old Towne district, community events, and family-friendly neighborhoods.

faqs.question: How are the schools in Orange?
faqs.answer: Orange Unified School District offers a range of highly rated public schools serving the city.

faqs.question: What parks and recreation are available?
faqs.answer: Irvine Regional Park provides hiking, picnicking, and a small zoo, plus various community parks throughout the city.

faqs.question: How is the commute from Orange?
faqs.answer: Orange is well-connected by the 55 and 22 freeways, with average commutes of 30-45 minutes to nearby job centers.
